name: 'Star Trek' Children Online Quiz | 'Star Trek' - Various Characters | 25 Questions

questions.text: What is the first name of Dr. Beverly Crusher's son?
questions.explanation:
Wesley.

	Played by Wil Wheaton (TNG)

questions.text: What is Worf's son's name?
questions.explanation:
Alexander.

	Played (mostly) by Brian Bonsall, who also played Andrew Keaton on 'Family Ties'. Alexander was also played by Jon Paul Steuer in TNG ep 'Reunion', by James Sloyan as a time-traveling Alexander at age 50 in ep 'Firstborn', and by Marc Worden as a teenaged Alexander in DS9 ep 'Sons and Daughters'.

questions.text: Miles and Keiko O'Brien eventually had two children. Their names:
questions.explanation:
Molly and Yoshi.

	Molly was born in TNG ep 'Disaster' with Worf as midwife. Yoshi was transfered while still developing to Major Kira's body after Keiko was injured in an accident while pregnant. (This was, of course, to write in Nana Visitor's pregnancy.) Yoshi was delivered in DS9 ep 'The Begotten'.

questions.text: She played Mary in TOS ep 'And the Children Shall Lead'.
questions.explanation:
Pamelyn Ferdin.

	Ms. Ferdin also supplied the voice of Lucy Van Pelt in the first theatrically-released 'Peanuts' movie 'A Boy Named Charlie Brown'.

questions.text: He played Jahn in TOS episode 'Miri'
questions.explanation:
Michael J. Pollard

	Michael J. Fox's real middle name is Andrew. He chose J as a middle inital in reference to Michael J. Pollard.

questions.text: This Ferengi boy went from being a petty thief on Deep Space 9 to an honored Starfleet ensign.
questions.explanation:
Nog.

	Nog, Rom's son and Quark's nephew, was played by Aron Eisenberg. Eisenberg also played Kar in VOY ep 'Initiations'.

questions.text: TOS: This 17-year-old boy was rescued by the SS Antares. Unknown to them, he had been given super mental powers in order to survive on a hostile planet. His name was:
questions.correct: Charlie & Charles & Charlie Evans & Charles Evans
questions.explanation:
Charlie & Charles & Charlie Evans & Charles Evans.

	TOS ep 'Charlie X': Played by Robert Walker, Jr., who was actually in his mid 20's.

questions.text: Ensign Wildman's daughter's name:
questions.explanation:
Naomi.

	Played by Scarlett Pomers.

questions.text: Couselor Troi gave birth to a son after a 1-day pregnancy in TNG ep 'The Child'. He was named Ian Andrew, after:
questions.explanation: Troi's father.

questions.text: Picard's nephew, son of his brother Robert:
questions.explanation:
Rene.

	Played by David Tristan Birkin in TNG ep 'Family'. Birkin also played a young Jean-Luc Picard in TNS ep 'Rascals'. In Star Trek: Generations, Rene was played by Christopher James Miller.

questions.text: TOS ep 'Friday's Child': Eleen names her baby __________ Akaar.
questions.explanation:
Leonard James.

	After McCoy and Kirk, who helped keep her safe from her late husband's Klingon-backed enemies. (So did Spock, but did he get credit? (Kinda, since he was played by Leonard Nimoy))

questions.text: He played Jean-Luc Riker, Will Riker's son, in 'Future Imperfect':
questions.explanation:
Chris Demetral.

	Demetral also played Jeremy Tupper on HBO's 'Dream On'.

questions.text: Data's 'pen pal' in TNG ep 'Pen Pals':
questions.explanation:
Sarjenka.

	Played by Nikki Cox.

questions.text: TNG ep 'The Dauphin': the girl to whom the episode title refers:
questions.explanation:
Salia.

	The U.S.S. Enterprise is assigned to escort Salia (Jaime Hubbard) and her guardian from the planet Klavdia III, where they have lived almost all of the girl's life, to Daled IV, the planet she was born to rule.

questions.text: Seven of Nine was assimilated into the Borg when she was a child. What was her name she used as a child?
questions.explanation:
Annika Hansen.

	Played by Katelin Petersen in VOY ep 'Dark Frontier'. All the other names are the children of Dr. Jim Hansen on 'Providence'.

questions.text: Capt Sisko's son:
questions.explanation:
Jake.

	Played by Cirroc Lofton.

questions.text: What was Kirk's nephew's name?
questions.explanation:
Peter.

	TOS ep 'Operation - Annihilate!' Played by Craig Hundley.

questions.text: Where did Keiko give birth to her first child?
questions.explanation:
In Ten Forward.

	TNG ep 'Disaster'. 10-Forward was a triage center after the ship ran into a cosmic phenomena.

questions.text: TAS: Episode name where all of the crew being aging backward until they were almost all in childhood.
questions.correct: The Counter-Clock Incident & The Counter Clock Incident & Counter-Clock Incident & Counter Clock Incident
questions.explanation:
The Counter-Clock Incident & The Counter Clock Incident & Counter-Clock Incident & Counter Clock Incident.

	Fortunately, the first captain and ships doctor of the Enterprise, Robert and Sarah April, were on board and thus didn't age to the point of childhood. (This was the last episode of TAS produced.)

questions.text: TOS: Miri was played by this actress:
questions.explanation: Kim Darby.

questions.text: TNG ep 'Imaginary Friend': Little girl who has the imaginary friend:
questions.explanation:
Clara Sutter.

	Played by Noley Thornton.

questions.text: TNG ep 'True Q': Who played Amanda Rogers, who was a human born of two former Q's who had become humans themselves, but then inherited Q powers?
questions.explanation:
Olivia d'Abo.

	Ms. d'Abo is better known as Kevin's older sister in the TV show 'The Wonder Years'.

questions.text: Who is the only character who does not have a mixed species child?
questions.explanation:
Beverly Crusher.

	Wes was ultimately unique, but nothing was ever said that he wasn't fully Human. Worf's son Alexander is 3 quarters Klingon, 1 quarter Human. Sarek's son Spock is half-Vulcan half-Human. Samantha's daughter Naomi is half-Human half-Ktarian.

questions.text: DS9: In what episode does Odo adopt a baby changeling?
questions.explanation:
The Begotten & Begotten.

	The station is buzzing with the news that Kira has finally gone into labor. But Odo is surprisingly uninterested, having his own 'baby' to deal with. The former Changeling has purchased an ailing infant Changeling from Quark, and, after Dr. Bashir heals the creature, begins the task of trying to teach his 'child' to shapeshift. He is clearly displeased when Dr. Mora, the Bajoran scientist who 'raised' Odo, arrives on the station to help.

questions.text: TNG: Of all the main title characters (those listed in the opening credits) ever listed, which one was NEVER noted as having children, whether real, theoretical, imaginary, or simply mentioned in passing?
questions.explanation:
Wesley Crusher.

	Jean-Luc Picard - Jason Vigo (Ken Olandt) was possibly his son, ep 'Bloodlines', or in Star Trek: Generations, Picard has a family after he enters the nexus; Will Riker - Jean-Luc Riker in 'Future Imperfect'; Geordi La Forge - children mentioned in 'All Good Things'; Tasha Yar - Sela (Denise Crosby), first appeared in 'Redemption, Part I'; Worf - Alexander, first appeared in 'Reunion'; Beverly Crusher - Wesley Crusher; Deanna Troi - Ian Andrew (R.J. Williams), ep 'The Child'; Data - Lal (Hallie Todd), ep 'The Offspring'
